target_audience.demographics: 25-40 years old, lives in Yunusabad/Chilanzar/Mirabad, uses Payme/Click daily.
target_audience.psychographics: Values time over money. Fears 'remont' (renovation) disasters. Hates negotiating prices at the bazaar. Trusts Telegram over Google.
target_audience.master_profile: Skilled plumber tired of standing at Kuyluk bazaar waiting for work. Wants a steady stream of orders via phone.

strategy.uvp: TashkentPlumbFix: The 'Uber for Plumbers' inside your Telegram. No apps to download, no random prices. Verified masters in 3 clicks.
channels: Local Facebook Groups (Potrebitel.uz - specifically for trust building)

viral_mechanics.loop_1: The 'Mahalla Shield': Invite 3 neighbors to the bot, get 'Priority Status' (Master arrives in <30 mins). Logic: If your neighbor's pipe bursts, YOU get flooded too. It's in your interest to have them on the app.
viral_mechanics.loop_2: Master Verification Badge: Masters get a generated 'ID Card' image to share on their status/stories, driving traffic back to the bot.

content_plan.format: Storytelling Post + Button to Mini App

content_plan.topic: How it Works: No Calls, Just Clicks
Educational: 3 Things to do before the master arrives

posts.image_prompt: A split screen 3D render. Left side: A chaotic, flooded apartment in Tashkent with a stressed person holding a phone. Right side: A calm, clean interface of a Telegram Mini App with a green shield icon. High contrast, isometric view.

posts.text:
ğŸ§  **Lifehack: What to do while waiting for the Usta?**

Don't just stand there with a bucket! If you have a leak, every second counts. Here is the TashkentPlumbFix protocol:

1ï¸âƒ£ **Shut the Main Valve:** Usually located behind the toilet or under the sink. Turn it clockwise until it stops.
2ï¸âƒ£ **Open the Faucets:** Drain the remaining water in the pipes to relieve pressure.
3ï¸âƒ£ **Take a Photo:** Upload it to our Mini App. This helps the master bring the exact right parts (no more "I need to go buy a part" delays).

ğŸ’¡ *Did you know?* 40% of flood damage happens because people can't find the main valve. Go check yours right now!

**Need a pro? Tap the button below.**
posts.image_prompt: A minimalist, flat-design infographic in blue and white tones. Step 1: Hand turning a valve. Step 2: Water draining from a tap. Step 3: Smartphone taking a photo of a pipe. Text labels in Russian/Uzbek style font.
